result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shyanne Nannette Sullivan

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Schmidt. arc   e: DA
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Satorius.  Appointing Atty Schmidt. sm
Filed by DA Office Karn W. arc

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Desiree B. and Rachel B., or their residence The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

- Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY.

1:40 PM CO: TCH, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brain Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for DE, Defendant Shyanne Nannette Sullivan in court, in custody by video. DE confirms address. DE qualifies for public defender. Waives reading. NG. Court sets bond. Court sets PSC. Atty. Schmidt advises DE to contact PD's office to provide mailing address. Adjourned: 1:44 PM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
